page.title: 01Ullswater and Howtown
page.content: A large percentage of the area is covered by Ullswater now a watersports centre excepting water skiing which is prohibited by a recent local by-law in response to pressure from environmentalists to reduce the noise level. The Outward Bound School and Howtown Outdoor Education Centre are well positioned to take advantage of both mountain and water environments. The population is sparse consisting of local residents and second home owners. The latter tend to falsely inflate the price of property to the exclusion of young local people who are then forced to leave the locality. The local residents are employed in the main either in agriculture including hill farming (sheep) and conservation, or providing for the large influx of tourists particularly during the summer months.
